channel.title: How to create combat npcs
channel.description:
[b]Perpose[/b]:this tutorial is to help people to make new training areas
[b]Difficulty[/b]:4
[b]Assumed Knowledge[/b]:How to find monster ids
[b]Server Base[/b]:testscape
[b]Classes Modified[/b]:npc.CFG and autospawn.CFG or autospawn2.CFG
[u][b]Procedure[/b][/u]
[b]step 1[/b]: pick the monster that you are going to add and then open npc.CFG in notepad or wordpad in my example we are going to use jad then if go to the bottom and add a line for the monster [b]if there is not alredy one in there![/b] if yu add a line when there is alredy one for your monster then it will not work if you are adding a line then ither use my example code (#s mean tabs because they dont show up)[code]npc = 2745#Jad####702#1000[/code]or you could type your own code to do this you must type [code]npc = npc id#npc name####combat level#monster hp[/code] or if the line is alredy there then you just need to type a combat level and hp in there make sure you save the changes
[b]step 2[/b]:we are now going to add the npc to the autospawn so open up autospawn.CFG or autospawn2.CFG in notepad or wordpad and then hit enter after the last line and then you can use my example code [code]spawn#= 2745#3214#3421#0#3214#3421#3214#3421#1#Jad[/code] i shall now xplane this code the 2745 is the moster id the 3214 is the x coord and the 3421 is the y coord [b]to find out coords in game you just type ::mypos[/b] the 0 is the hight of the location the next four are the range coordinates witch are used to make a box in whitch the monster will move around in and you do this by typing in coords in this order max x coord max y coord lowest x coord lowest y coord the 1 is the walktype and you should just leave this at 1 where it says jad you just write the name of the npc save changes
[b]screenshot [/b]: [img]http://sigstorage.net/uploads/newtutscreenie.bmp[/img]
[b]credits[/b]:me[br][size=1]Posted at: November 16, 2006, 05:19:26 PM[/size][hr]do people think i shouold leave the dfifficulty at 4?

item.title: How to create combat npcs
item.dc:creator: @mrmad1 mrmad1
item.description:
@mrmad1 wrote:

Perpose:this tutorial is to help people to make new training areas

Difficulty:4

Assumed Knowledge:How to find monster ids

Server Base:testscape

Classes Modified:npc.CFG and autospawn.CFG or autospawn2.CFG

Procedure

step 1: pick the monster that you are going to add and then open npc.CFG in notepad or wordpad in my example we are going to use jad then if go to the bottom and add a line for the monster if there is not alredy one in there! if yu add a line when there is alredy one for your monster then it will not work if you are adding a line then ither use my example code (#s mean tabs because they dont show up)npc = 2745#Jad####702#1000or you could type your own code to do this you must type npc = npc id#npc name####combat level#monster hp or if the line is alredy there then you just need to type a combat level and hp in there make sure you save the changes

step 2:we are now going to add the npc to the autospawn so open up autospawn.CFG or autospawn2.CFG in notepad or wordpad and then hit enter after the last line and then you can use my example code spawn#= 2745#3214#3421#0#3214#3421#3214#3421#1#Jad
i shall now xplane this code the 2745 is the moster id the 3214 is the x coord and the 3421 is the y coord to find out coords in game you just type ::mypos the 0 is the hight of the location the next four are the range coordinates witch are used to make a box in whitch the monster will move around in and you do this by typing in coords in this order max x coord max y coord lowest x coord lowest y coord the 1 is the walktype and you should just leave this at 1 where it says jad you just write the name of the npc save changes
